communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (October 2021-October 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance"  in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Chronic Nuisance Properties" as described in Section 16-22 of Providence's city code. 

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance

•  Notice to Vacate's filed by property owners as a result of nuisance abatement 

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance 

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The FBI file of Albert Mildvan, former professor at the University of Pennsylvania. His obituary is available here:

https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/inquirer/name/albert-mildvan-obituary?id=9217869

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

reemccarthy

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Gabriel Kolko
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The FBI file of Gabriel Kolko, former History professor at the University of Pennsylvania. His obituary is available here:

https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/11/us/gabriel-kolko-left-leaning-historian-of-us-policy-dies-at-81.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

reemccarthy

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The FBI file of Robin Maisel, lawyer and a former student at the University of Pennsylvania. He was born 6/28/1944 and passed away September 17th, 2020, according to his obituary:

https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/sandiegouniontribune/name/robin-maisel-obituary?pid=196859490

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

reemccarthy
